Package reso.examples.selectiveRepeat

Class SelectiveRepeatProtocol

java.lang.Object
reso.examples.selectiveRepeat.SelectiveRepeatProtocol
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPInterfaceListener
public class SelectiveRepeatProtocol extends Object implements IPInterfaceListener
Implementation of the pipelining protocol SelectiveRepeat with a congestion control with the same behavior as TCP RENO (additive increase, Multiplicative decrease, slow start). In this implementation, only integers can be sent.

  • Constructor Details

    • SelectiveRepeatProtocol

      public SelectiveRepeatProtocol​(IPHost host, int packetNbr, double packetLossProbability)
      SENDER constructor
      Parameters:
      host - The host of the sender side of the protocol.
      packetNbr - The number of packets he's going to send.
      packetLossProbability - The probability to lose a packet

  • Method Details

    • receive

      public void receive​(IPInterfaceAdapter src, Datagram datagram) throws Exception
      The protocol reception behavior.

      If the packet we received is an ACK, we are in the SENDER side. Each time we receive an ack, the SelectiveRepeatProtocol.Timer of the packet is stopped (know with a table of SelectiveRepeatProtocol.Timer) and we calculate the RTO.
      The window size is increased here (slow start, additive increase).

      Specified by:
      receive in interface IPInterfaceListener
      Parameters:
      src - source of the message.
      datagram - IP datagram of the message, used to get the data of the message.
      Throws:
      Exception
      See Also:
      If the packet isn't an ack, we are in the RECEIVER SIDE. We're always sending an ack if we receive a packet, even if we had already received the packet., sendAck(Datagram)

    • sendData

      public void sendData​(int data, IPAddress dst) throws Exception
      sendData method that the sender use to send data.

      It buffers his data and send it to the destination directly if the window is big enough. If not, the packets will wait in the buffer.

      Parameters:
      data - The data the sender wants to transfer
      dst - The destination of the message
      Throws:
      Exception

    • sendAck

      public void sendAck​(Datagram datagram) throws Exception
      Send ACKNOWLEDGMENT method of the protocol.

      It tries to send the packet with a chance to lose the ACK.

      Parameters:
      datagram - IP datagram of the message, used to get the sequence number and the src of the message.
      Throws:
      Exception
      See Also:
      Logger.logAckLoss(Packet)

    • timeout

      public void timeout​(IPAddress dst, int seqNumber) throws Exception
      The timer of the packet has ended, the packet has been lost.

      Changes the RTO, the window size and resend the message.

      Parameters:
      dst - The destination of the message.
      seqNumber - The sequence number of the packet
      Throws:
      Exception
      See Also:
      Logger.logLoss(int, double, double)

    • getSRTT

      public double getSRTT​(reso.examples.selectiveRepeat.SelectiveRepeatProtocol.Timer timer)
      SRTT calculation method.
      Parameters:
      timer - Timer of the packet we want to get the SRTT.
      Returns:
      The value of the SRTT of a certain packet.

    • setRTO

      public void setRTO​(reso.examples.selectiveRepeat.SelectiveRepeatProtocol.Timer timer)
      Set the value of the RTO.

      It uses this formula : RTO = 2 * RTO

      Parameters:
      timer - Timer of the packet from which we want to set the RTO.
